titleStmt.title: Tracking Text Variants in Book VIII of Ovid's Metamorphoses

listWit.witness:
Δarchetypus codicum MNUS
M Florence San Marco 225 saec. xi
Italy Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana S.Marco 225
Contains verses 1.1-14.830 with some passages omitted. Missing are 13.276-343, 14.272-307, and 8.340-402. Verses from the last passage were added by three later hands. The manuscript contains the so-called Lactantian narrations within the text.
Includes folios 1-119, written on parchment, 310 x 175 mm.
M c This interpolating hand of M is responsible for at least 3 orthographical variants, 1 lexical, 1 addition 2 omissions, and 3 corrections. M 2c An alternate verse of 693, that is 693a-b, is inserted into this manuscript by an interpolating hand. At 698, this hand suggests lexical variations on the first half of the verse in the margin.
N Naples IV.F.3 saec. xi or xii
Southern Italy Napoli Biblioteca Nazionale BNN ms. IV.F.3
Contains 1.1-14.838 by one hand, then 14.839-15.879 by others. Verses 8.340-402 and 13.276-343 are omitted but supplied by a few later hands. The Lanctantian marginalia, accompanied by beautiful colored illustrations, are present in some books but not others.
Composed of 201 folios of about 30 lines each on parchment. Folios 4-188 are written in Bari type of Benventan script, and folios 189-201 are written by later hands that finished the poem in Gothic script. Two folios, containing 1.198-255 and 2.121-81, were destroyed, and supplied later by a fourteenth century hand.
N c Multiple interpolating hands of N are responsible for at least 2 orthographical variants, 3 morphological, 2 lexical, as well as 3 corrections. Lines 652-655a are added in the margin by a later manuscript hand, just as 693a-b are. N 2c> This later interpolating hand of N is responsible for correcting 1 orthographical variant.
Vatican City Urbinas lat. 341 U saec. xi or xii
Vatican City Biblioteca Apostolica Vaticana Urb.Lat.341
Written in the Benventan script of the Bari type and contains 1.1-15.879. Passages 1.413-470, 4.232-283, and 4.543-603 are written by a separate thirteenth century hand. Verses 1.1-75 and 15.494-879 are supplied by another thirteenth century hand. The manuscript also contains the Lactantian narrations.
Each of the 183 folios contains 37 lines on parchment measuring mm. 310 x 287.
U c The second interpolating hand of U is responsible for creating 1 orthographical variant and correcting a lexical variant. U 3c This interpolating hand is responsible for one orthographical and one lexical variant, and is thought to have created these variants later than the first interpolating hand of U.
S Spirensis saec. xi
Germany Det Kongelige Bibliotek NKS 56 2°
The only known extant manuscript from the lost codex of Speyer. Contains 9.324-10.707 with the Lactantian narrations. Designated as quaternio no. 7, and included in Nicolas Heinsius' seventeenth century collation with other surviving manuscripts from the lost codex. The text contains all or part of the Lactantian narrations.
This seventh quaternio includes 8 parchment folios with two columns of 41 lines each, measuring mm. 325 x 230.
S 2 Line 693a-b is added in by this interpolating hand, just as in M and N. This hand is also responsible for one lexical variant in the text.

Σarchetypus codicum PGLTB
B Paris lat. 8001 saec. xii or xiii
Germany Bibliothèque nationale de France Lat. 8001
Contains 1.1-15.879, with 1.1-6.590 by one twelfth century hand and 6.591-end by another.
Comprises folios 1-16 and 23-69 on parchment, with 6 additional leaves of commentary inserted after folio 16. The verses are in two columns of 48 lines each, measuring mm. 265 x 190.
B c This hand is responsible for correcting one orthographical and one morphological variant in the text.
L Florence Plut. 36.12 saec. xi or xii
Germany Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana Plut.36.12
Contains 1.1-12.298 with the narrations of Lactantius in red ink in the margins.
Comprises 73 folios on parchment, with 60-64 lines each, measuring mm. 277 x 145.
Many glosses or corrections in this manuscript, but notably none within the passage of concern.
P Vatican City Pal. lat. 1669 saec. xi
Germaany Biblioteca Apostolica Vaticana Pal.lat.1669
Contains verses 1.1-15.879 and the narrations of Lactantius, in the form of red-ink titles, are added in the margins.
Comprises 64 folios with two columns of 48 or 49 lines each on parchment, measuring mm. 315 x 240. Readings in folios 14-24 are missing or difficult to discern in many place.
P c This interpolating hand is reposnible for at least one morphological variant.
T Munich clm 29208 + Cgm 4286 saec.xi
Germany München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek Clm 29208
Contains about 2,000 verses from books 1, 2, 4, 6, 8-15.
Two leaf fragments from a once complete manuscipt written in the Gothic minuscule style.
T 2 Responsible for at least one lexical variant within the text.
G Florence San Marco 223 saec. xi
Possibly Italy
Contains verses 1.1-15.879, apart from lacking one quaternio that contains 8.548-10.428.
Made up of two manuscripts comprising folios 2-56 written on parchment in two columns of 55 or 57 lines. Measures mm. 340 x 230. Contains the narrations of Lactantius, and followed by the Metamorphoses are Ovid's Nux, Medicamina Faciei Femineae and Tristia by other hands.
G c This interpolating hand is responsible for at least one orthographical variant. G 3c These hands represent interpolations and variants added later. In some spots, a correction has fixed an orthographical variant.

body.l: Amnis ab his tacuit. factum mirabile cunctos
mouerat; inridet credentes, utque deorum
spretor erat mentisque ferox, Ixione natus:
'ficta refers nimiumque putas, Acheloe, potentes
esse deos' dixit, 'si dant adimuntque figuras.'
obstipuere omnesnec talia dicta probarunt,
ante omnesque Lelex animo maturus et aeuo
sic ait: 'immensa est finemque potentia caeli
non habet et quidquid superi uoluere peractum est.
quoque minus dubites, tiliae contermina quercus
collibus est Phrygiis, medio modico circumdata muro.
ipse locum uidi, nam me Pelopeia Pittheus
misit in arua suo quondam regnata parenti parente
haud procul hinc stagnum est, tellus habitabilis olim,
nunc celebres mergis fulcisque palustribus undae.
Iuppiter huc specie mortali mortalis cumque parente
uenit Atlantiades positis caducifer alis.
mille domos adiere locum requiemque petentes,
mille domos clausere serae. tamen una recepit,
parua quidem stipulis et canna tecta palustri,
sed pia Baucis anus parilique aetate Philemon

app.lem: illa sunt annis iuncti iuuenalibus, illa

body.l: effecere leuem nec iniqua mente ferendo ferendam .
nec refert, dominos illic famulosne requiras:
tota domus duo sunt, idem parentque iubentque.
'Ergo ubi caelicolae paruos paucos tetigere Penates
submissoque humiles intrarunt uertice postes,
membra senex posito iussit releuare sedili,
quo quod superiniecit textum rude sedula Baucis.
inde inque foco tepidum cinerem dimouit et ignes
suscitat hesternos foliisque et cortice sicco
nutrit et ad flammas anima producit perducit perduxit anili,
multifidasque faces ramaliaque arida tecto
detulit et minuit paruoque admouit aeno,
quodque suus coniunx riguo collegerat horto
truncat holus foliis; furca leuat ille illa bicorni
sordida terga suis nigro pendentia tigno
seruatoque diu resecat de tergore partem
exiguam sectamque domat feruentibus undis.
interea medias fallunt sermonibus horas

lem.l: sentirique et sentire moram prohibent. erat alueus illic
fagineus, dura clauo suspensus ab ansa;
is tepidis impletur aquis artusque fouendos
accipit. in medio torus est de mollibus uluis
impositus impositum imposito impositis lecto sponda pedibusque salignis
concutiuntque torum de molli fluminis ulua

rdg.l: impositum impositis lecto sponda pedibusque salignis

body.l: uestibus hunc uelant quas non nisi tempore festo
sternere consuerant, sed et haec uilisque uetusque
uestis erat, lecto non indignanda saligno.
accubere dei. mensamsuccincta tremensque
ponit anus, mensae sed erat pes tertius impar;
testa parem fecit, quae postquam subdita cliuum
sustulit, aequatam aequatum equatum mentae tersere et tersere extersere uirentes.
ponitur hic bicolor sincerae baca Mineruae
conditaque in liquida corna autumnalia faece
intibaque et radix et lactis massa coacti
ouaque non acri leuiter uersata fauilla,
omnia fictilibus; post haec caelatus eodem
sistitur argento crater fabricataque fago
pocula, qua qu(a)e caua sunt, flauentibus inlita ceris.
parua mora est, epulasque foci misere calentes;
nec longae rursus referuntur uina senectae
dantque locum mensis paulum seducta secundis.
hic nux, hic mixta est rugosis carica palmis
prunaque et in patulis redolentia olentia uoluntia uolentia mala canistris
et de purpureis collectae uitibus uuae;
candidus in medio fauus est. super omnia uultus
accessere boni nec iners pauperque uoluntas.
Interea totiens haustum haustum totiens exhaustum totiens cratera repleri
sponte sua per seque uident succrescere sua crescere uina;
attoniti nouitate pauent manibusque supinis
concipiunt Baucisque preces timidusque Philemon

lem.l: et ueniam dapibus nullisque paratibus orant

body.l: unicus anser erat, minimae custodia uillae,
quem dis hospitibus domini mactare parabant;
ille celer penna tardos aetate fatigat
eluditque diu tandemque est uisus ad ipsos
confugisse deos. superi uetere necari
"di" que "sumus, meritasque luet uicinia poenas
impia" dixerunt; "uobis immunibus huius"
esse mali dabitur. modo uestra relinquite tecta
ac nostros comitate gradus et in ardua montis

lem.l: ite simul. parent ambo baculisque leuati

rdg.l: ite simul. parent et dis praeeuntibus ambo
membra leuant baculis tardique senilibus annis

body.l: nituntur longo uestigia ponere cliuo.
tantum aberant summo quantum semel ire sagitta
missa potest; flexere oculos et mersa palude

app.lem: cetera prospiciunt, tantum sua tecta manere
app.rdg: mersa uident queruntque sue pia culmina uille
mersa uident plerumque sue pia culmina uille

app.lem: dumque ea mirantur, dum deflent fata suorum
app.rdg: sola loco stabant. dum deflent fata suorum
dumque loco stabant. dum plangunt fata suorum
sola loco stabant. cum deflent fata suorum

body.l: illa uetus dominis etiam casa parua duobus
uertitur in templum; furcas subiere columnae,
stramina flauescunt aurataque adopertaque ornataque tecta uidentur
caelataeque fores adopertaque marmore tellus.
talia tum cum dum placido Saturnius edidit ore:
"dicite, iuste senex et femina coniuge iusto
digna, quid optetis." cum Baucide pauca locutus
iudicium superis aperit commune Philemon:
"esse sacerdotes delubraque uestra tueri
poscimus, et quoniam concordes egimus annos,
auferat hora duos eadem, nec coniugis umquam
busta meae uideam neu sim tumulandus tumulatus ab illa."
uota fides sequitur; templi tutela fuere,
donec uita data est. annis aeuoque soluti
ante gradus sacros cum starent forte locique
narrarent narrassent inciperent casus, frondere Philemona Baucis,
Baucida conspexit senior frondere Philemon.
iamque super geminos crescente cacumine uultus
mutua, dum licuit, reddebant dicta "uale" que
"o coniunx" dixere simul, simul abdita texit
ora frutex. ostendit adhuc Thyneius illic
incola de gemino gemina uicinos corpore arbore truncos.
haec mihi non uani (neque erat cur fallere uellent)
narrauere senes; equidem pendentia uidi
serta super ramos ponensque recentia dixi:
"cura deum di sunt sint , et qui coluere coluntur colantur ."
